intro: Lessingia ramulosa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. This variety is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species found in dry, well-drained soils.
